at.ac.tuwien.infosys.jcloudscale.utility

Class CancellationToken

  • java.lang.Object
    • at.ac.tuwien.infosys.jcloudscale.utility.CancellationToken

  • public class CancellationToken
extends Object
    Author:
    RST Cancellation token class that allows to cancel asynchronous operation from the outside.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CancellationToken()
      Creates a new instance of CancellationToken
      CancellationToken(CancellationToken parentToken)
      Creates a new instance of CancellationToken with parentToken specified.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void cancel()
      Cancels the token.
      boolean isCancelled()
      Determines if the operation has to be cancelled.
      static boolean isCancelled(CancellationToken token)
      Allows to check if provided token is cancelled.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • CancellationToken

        public CancellationToken()
        Creates a new instance of CancellationToken

      • CancellationToken

        public CancellationToken(CancellationToken parentToken)
        Creates a new instance of CancellationToken with parentToken specified.
        Parameters:
        parentToken - The parent token. If the parent token will be cancelled, this token will report as cancelled as well.

    • Method Detail

      • cancel

        public void cancel()
        Cancels the token.

      • isCancelled

        public boolean isCancelled()
        Determines if the operation has to be cancelled. Asynchronous operations are expected to check this method periodically.
        Returns:
        true if operation was cancelled. Otherwise, false.

      • isCancelled

        public static boolean isCancelled(CancellationToken token)
        Allows to check if provided token is cancelled. This operation is useful if you don't want to check for a null in addition.
        Parameters:
        token - The token to check or null.
        Returns:
        true if token is provided and it is cancelled. Otherwise, false.
